result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deandre Dwayne Simms

Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as counsel for Defendant.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Deandre Dwayne Simms.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant has not been extradited due to a pending case in Branch 4; case 22CF709. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court sets bail to $50,000.00. Defense requested status conference date. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 36. Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Deandre Dwayne Simms.  Prosecuting attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was argumentative and was not produced, Court waived appearance. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Due to court being DOWN, court rescheduled status conference with parties via email correspondence. Case adjourned to September 1st, 2022 at 8:30 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 4 advises will not retain case and sends back to general felony calendar Br. 38.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Staus Conference. Defendant has not been extradited as he has a pending cas in Branch 4. Court will adjourn this matter to that calendar to tag along. Case adjourned,Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Status Conference. Defendant has previously waived extradition however, he has a pending case in Branch 4. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

03:44 PM Defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of California.  Defendant waived extradition.  Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Attorney William Rakestraw received and filed

Defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms in Court with Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Deandre Dwayne Simms in custody.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Court found the Defendant is the person wanted in the State of California. Defendant contested extradition. Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 38. Status hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 11:00 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 635 of the Courthouse.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
